title: Bug 22360[Fonts] FontRegistry can not instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource
description: Bug 22360[Fonts] FontRegistry can not be instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource. Therefore, all the resources that are being looked up are the only ones relative to the location of the FontRegistry class org.eclipse.jface.resource path. It can be remedied if FontRegistry took a client class (or class loader) as an additional parameter to the constructor.
EB: I expected that I should be able to create a FontRegistry instance using the 'com.company.product.fonts' resource without encountering a MissingResourceException. The FontRegistry class should be able to handle resources located outside the 'org.eclipse.jface.resource' path.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a class 'com.company.product.MyClass'.
2. Within the 'MyClass' class, define a method 'createFontRegistry()'.
3. Inside the 'createFontRegistry()' method, attempt to create a FontRegistry instance using the following code:

```java
FontRegistry fonts = new FontRegistry("com.company.product.fonts");
```
4. Run the application, and the MissingResourceException should be encountered.
